message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper deals with natural language processing tasks such as textual entailment and answer selection, which are typically categorized under the arXiv sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also proposes an architecture based on Gated Recurrent Unit, which is a popular deep learning model used in various AI applications, indicating a possible fit under the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also involves representation learning and alignment of phrases, which are common topics in the sub-categories of Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Information Retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper's focus on phrase alignment and task-specific pooling suggests a possible fit under the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE).
